So glad we went the extra mile to come here! We had a beautiful meal for a great price. Wonderful ambience and friendly service. I had a foie gras creme brûlée for starters! Mains were deer, Guinea fowl, duck, lamb with gorgeous mash and creamed spinach. Totally recommended!

It was great to have suggestions on the wine paring, and to be able to taste different wine types. The sweet Malbec was another discovery, we took a bottle home. The prices are fair and the service very attentive. We spent a nice evening at Casa Coupage!

review_data.review_title: Amazing food in a serene setting
review_data.review: WILD was one of the first restaurants I visited when I moved to Siem Reap. After the first I visited I was hooked. The spring rolls at WILD are delicious! Along with the traditional fillings they also offer a wide variety of savoury and sweet ones not to mention that their cocktails are amazing! The restaurant itself is a gorgeous place to spend time. The owners have kept the number of tables low for the amount of space they have and the result is well worth it. Be aware if you want to visit on the weekends however, this place is extremely popular and is usually fully booked! I would recommend WILD to anyone looking for a relaxed atmosphere and delicious food.

The were issues with my food, and we got to sent it back to the kitchen. The staff argued, but when the manager came and look, he didnt argue and took it back and sent it back to the kitchen. review_data.review_title: Good food, good service, at a good price
review_data.review: We had a very enjoyable dinner and time at this place. We had the chicken spring rolls as a starter. A t-bone and a tenderloin as mains. And several margaritas.  The service is attentive and very friendly.  A bread plate is served which looks just like cut sliced bread but is in fact quite nice and we had a second helping.  The spring rolls were good and the accompanying sauce is not overly sweet as is often the case, but not here.  The t-bone was very nice. A bit of char and smoky flavour. It was ordered medium-rare and came slightly over but it was still heartily enjoyed.  The tenderloin was a much thicker cut and also ordered medium-rare. It came slightly under.  The presentation of the steaks and the condiments is excellent.  The margaritas were very good and generous with the tequila.  Coffees and more banter with the staff finished a very enjoyable night and our best meal in Siem Reap over three days.  The food for the price plus the service makes this place a winner. Slight variances in done-ness of the meat did not detract enough for us. We would return to this place anytime we are in Siem Reap.

review_data.review: We had just visited the fort museum and fancied a small lunch and a pint, so we thought we’d try the Fisherman’s Hub as they served alcohol and food.  Although a little dark (no windows) we were greeted with a smile and shown to our table and given the menus and asked what we’d like to drink, we ordered a still water, Diet Coke and a pint of Stella.  The menu was quite comprehensive for a pub and served both western as well as middle eastern food and Indian dishes as well.  We ordered Salt and Pepper Prawns and Calamari and as one of the party could not have any oil or fat in their food and asked our waitress if the chef could make a plain rice dish with shredded chicken, she said that this would not be a problem.  She also pointed out that the two dishes we had ordered included a beer or wine, exceptional value as the Prawn dish with a Stella was 45 Dirhams and the Calamari with another pint of Stella was 47 Dirhams ( extremely good value in Dubai)  The food arrived and was fantastic, really tasty and such good value, the the service by our waitress (I’m so sorry I can’t remember your name) a young Indian lady was first rate.

review_data.review_title: Our go to when we want great food and great service
review_data.review: We return often, and each time are welcomed warmly and treated to the best Lebanese food in London. We have visited with friends from the UK, Lebanon, Syria, South Africa, Oman, Dubai, Singapore, Saudi Arabia, Yemen, Bangladesh and Turkey, and they all rate the food and service as excellent.  This time was no different.  We ordered the Yakhneh Loubieh (Green bean in tomato sauce) vegetarian and the Yakhnet Bameh (okra in tomato sauce) vegetarian. Both can be prepared as vegan if you mention it. The food was piping hot and delicious.  The service, as ever, was warm and attentive.  We've already made our next reservation.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Luxury Traveler

review_data.review: I booked a table for an early dinner, so that the restaurant would be quieter.  The staff, as always, gave me a warm welcome and offered me my choice of tables. I wanted a relaxed meal, while doing some reading, and the service was attentive and perfectly placed, so that I felt comfortable enough to take my time, but also so that I never waited for service.  I ordered the Taboulleh Twist, houmous Beiruty, Falafel and Yakhnet Batinjen Vegetarian, and enjoyed some Lebanese coffee with it. At the end, I had their refreshing Café Blanc with some baklava.  Every dish was amazing, and I would visit weekly if I could.

Chamisse is a staple in our London list. They always deliver great service and delicious food.  I took a friend - who knows Lebanese food well, and is involved in the restaurant industry - for dinner this week, and he was impressed with the quality and flavours.  We ordered a selection of the hot and cold mezze, and every dish was perfect.  Always happy to recommend Chamisse, and will no doubt be going back soon.

We consistently come back to Chamisse, and we're often bringing friends back with us.  The food is always delicious and the service attentive. We've come here with friends from the UK, Oman, Syria, South Africa, and they've all enjoyed the food and said how good it was.  Thank you to the staff for always being welcoming and for giving us somewhere to always share great food with good friends.

We visit Chamisse every couple of weeks and have never been let down.  We brought a friend here for dinner on Saturday evening, and again, the staff at Chamisse were incredibly welcoming. They were happy to make recommendations from the menu and were knowledgeable about all the dishes.  The food was delivered quickly, and every dish was tasty.  We've been visiting Chamisse for around two years now and have found it to be consistently excellent.  Were very happy to recommend.

This was the venue for the final evening of our tour of Vietnam and Cambodia and it was a fantastic choose by our travel company. The food was delicious and my husband even ate the crickets. The staff are delightful and make the whole experience even more enjoyable.

On an 11 day trip I tried many parillas. Food and service were very good and I was able to walk here from my hotel near the Oblisque. Prices reasonable.
Enjoyed petting their friendly cats. Had a delicious coffee ice mountain. Huge portion large enough to share. Super friendly staff.

review_data.review_title: Great atmosphere and food, lovely staff and all for a good cause. What more can you want?
review_data.review: I am a frequent customer (have been living in Siem Reap for a year) and this place is a great place to go for a bit of piece and quiet away from the usual noise in Siem Reap.  The food is great (I am vegan and they do have a vegan brunch, or a smoothie bowl) ) and the staff very pleasant and helpful.  If you are into the pastry/sweet cakes there is a lot of choice and everything is made fresh on the premises.  They also often have freshly made jam and peanut butter - certainly worth buying to take with you.  You can also order bread (the day before) which is freshly baked on the premises - and its healthy as well!  Bayon Pastry School is a training facility for girls/women who would otherwise struggle to get a reasonable job. Here they are taught the fine art of making pastries, cakes etc. and then have a great start to getting a decent paying job at the end of their 12 months training.

Cha Yam Bai is served in a towering beautiful bird cage of sweet & savoury bites. There is a fine collection of gourmet sandwiches, scones with jam & clotted cream and array of decorative desserts followed by tea & coffee. The cost of this experience was THB 15000++ thoroughly worth every cent, to spend the afternoon of classic indulgence. Enjoyed immensely relishing in the peaceful surrounding. Table 33 - It was the perfect location

Dan Perlman presents cuisine that is interesting and pairs it with local wines. We had a great evening with a very diverse group of travelers which made for a lovely meal. i was relieved to not eat a "slab of beef". The food was very inventive and a mix of South American Cuisines. Don't miss the closed door dining experience in BA- if they are full, ask for another recommendation. review_data.review: My husband and I were thrilled when we discovered that we would be in Siem Reap this year when the Sala Bai restaurant was open, as it is not open all year round. This year we took our daughters and my sister along. The menu wasn’t as extensive as it has been in previous years; which was a little disappointing, however, the food and service were amazing.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Luxury Traveler

review_data.review: My husband and I have been visiting Sala Bai for many years and this year was our first visit to their new location next to Wat Svey Temple (which is also worth a visit). We love Sala Bai so much that I made our first reservation from Australia before we left and we went there for lunch only hours after landing back in Siem Reap. We were not disappointed! We were greeted and seated in a most professional way, and the staff were lovely and friendly as always. Now for the best part - THE FOOD! I had the raw fish salad for my entrée and it was so unbelievably delicious that we went back numerous times and I always ordered the same entrée. My husband fell in love with the prawn Caesar salad, which is huge for an entrée. We tried something different every time for a main and everything we tried was just beautiful. The service staff are very attentive and the prices are very reasonable. All money goes towards their training program, which has a 100% success rate of placing graduates. Located only a couple of minutes out of town by tuk tuk ($6 for a return trip is heaps), it is well worth it. The restaurant area is located in the upstairs part of the building and it is lovely and cool. I can not praise Sala Bai, it's food and it's staff enough. Do yourself a favour and visit. You'll keep going back, I promise you!!

review_data.review_title: Excellent service, great food, and all for a good cause.
review_data.review: My fiance and I visited Sala Bai for a quick lunch. The service was the best we have received anywhere in Siem Reap (and I have been coming here for 6 years). We were given complimentary bread with butter and bruschetta, which was excellent. I ordered the fried rice with chicken, which was the best either of us had tasted anywhere. My fiance ordered the deep fried chicken with wedges. The chicken was a little dry, but once dipped into the tartar sauce that was provided it was quite nice. All money goes towards the staff, who all come from disadvantaged backgrounds, and the organisation has so far been able to place 100% of graduates into full time work within 3 months of graduating from here. Well worth the visit!

I really didn't know what to expect from this restaurant as I only knew the brand from its clothes (which are great!). However the food was really tasty, great portions and welcoming service. It was more of a rather dull fusion of sashimi and ceviche. As a whole the ceviche was ok, but it was definitely lame.  The place was packed with tourist (I believe only two French speakers) which is always a bad sign. When I left they asked me to review at TripAdvisor, which I tend to do quite often. However, places that ask their customers for reviews are seldom very good in my experience.  I get the feeling that this has probably been a great some time ago, but that by now it's becoming more of a TripAdvisor tourist trap. There are definitely better ceviche in Paris.

review_data.review: We like the food here. Service can be erratic. On this visit the front of the restaurant was sectioned off for a private holiday party. Needless to say they were enjoying their cocktails and were very loud. This impacted our leisurely dining experience in a negative way. I believe when restaurants decide to take large parties that will impact the "regular" diner, they should accommodate the other patrons in some way... a drink, dessert, something to acknowledge the inconvenience... not just think it's ok.  Our coconut shrimp, crab cakes, salads, and the taco soup were very good. Chicken and Tuna entrees were enjoyed by all. The cold mashed potatoes served with the chicken were happily replaced.  Wines and drinks were very good.  Not our best meal here but still like the restaurant. Service needs improvement and ask about parties that may be booked... I guess it will calm down after the holidays but still beware.

review_data.review_title: Great Laid Back Ambiance and Nice Chow
review_data.review: This is an unusual spot for Manhattan. Really nice ambiance, table spacing good, live music, excellent service... and really good food. Definitely feel like you're in an island setting, on vacation or something. We liked everything we had... duo (guac, cheese) with chips, coconut shrimp, taco soup. Love their chicken dish, the ribs, mahi mahi. Don't miss the key lime pie. Great bartender here as well.

review_data.review_title: Loved it so much we went back twice
review_data.review: My husband and I ate dinner here our first night in Lisbon. We made a reservation on google, and it was honored. Suggest making a reservation in advance, as it seems pretty popular. Just FYI the restaurant looks like it is in a residential area, depending on where you come from. But it is with a cluster of some other restaurants. Indoor/outdoor dining options.  The pasta is homemade and super fresh, almost as good as when we were in Italy. Great wine/drink list, and reasonable prices for what you get. Good selection of appetizers, and had very friendly service. They offer complimentary limoncello after dinner. The bathrooms were also very clean.  We ended up also having this as our last dinner, since it was so good. Lots of options for both meat eaters, and vegetarians. The appetizers are a very good size, and so were the pasta portions.  My husband had the linguine with prawns the first night, and said it was one of the best he has had. He also said the same about the Amatriciana (wasn't super spicy). I got the ragù the first night, which was excellent, and the macaroni with the asparagus & pancetta the 2nd night, which was super light and full of flavor.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Luxury Traveler

review_data.review_title: Husband and Wife team serving delicious, flavorful meals
review_data.review: 3 words - MAKE A RESERVATION. It was off-peak season when my husband and I went and we got a reservation through our hotel. Boy am I glad we did because we saw about 10 couples get turned down for not having one. Almost every table was marked "reserved" when we arrived at opening.  There is a good reason for the reservations because the food is so delicious, so flavorful, and home cooked right behind the counter by the husband of the husband/wife team. The wife serves the food and takes the orders and she is SO friendly (unless you dont have a reservation).  They have a good wine selection and the menu is significantly large. I was feeling a little under the weather when we got there so I got a soup - oh my gosh - it was just a simple mushroom soup but we soaked up every last drop with the bread and she came over and hugged us because she saw me soaking up the last bit of liquid and laughed at us. But it was that good. We also got the tomato balls, a must for being in Greece, and they were served with tzatziki, SO GOOD. My husband complimented that for a fried food it was so light. We also got the beer chicken and a seabass - both were amazing, we finished basically everything. They also give a complimentary dessert (assuming they rotate). Ours was some phyllo dough with some cream maybe (not really sure) but so good. The wife also takes a picture of every table and puts it on her facebook site, which I think is pretty cool.  We wanted to go back a second time in our 3 dinners we had in Santorini, but then figured we should try something else....regreted not going back. Absolute must - please go you will not be disappointed.

review_data.review_title: Incredible Breakfast Quality & Variety With Fantastic Views of Mai Khao Beach. Great Fruit Bar & Coffee Too! 🥭☕️
review_data.review: We spent one week at the JW Marriott Resort & Spa Phuket, and every breakfast at JW Cafe was a delightful breakfast.  Beautiful breakfast variety: a fresh fruit bar (ask for the mangoes and the Phuket pineapple ) - authentic Thai choices - live egg station serving an incredibly delicious omelette - pancakes, waffles, brûlée french toast with all the delicious toppings you could possibly think of - sausages, cold cuts and cheeses - live noodle station  The view was also something to look forward to every morning ☀️ Breakfast while gazing into the Mai Khao beach Absolutely gorgeous.  Our server Dada was very lovely, helpful and attentive. She always knew what we wanted before we asked for it; a double espresso and a cappuccino ☕️ Dada also made recommendations for us as well. Thanks for your help throughout our stay, Dada! We look forward to seeing you again next time :)

review_data.review_title: Bargain café at Petticoat Lane Market
review_data.review: There’s nothing to beat a good old-fashioned Full English Breakfast. Here at Café Nora (formerly Café Thyme), there are nine fry-ups to choose from, ranging from £6.95 to £7.95, all cooked to order and served with tea or freshly ground coffee and toast or bread. The English Breakfast of two eggs, two rashers of bacon, sausage, hash browns, baked beans, mushroom, black pudding and grilled tomatoes is a firm favourite. There’s also a Mediterranean Set Breakfast and Vegan Brunch with vegan sausage and avocado. For the more adventurous, there is Eggs Benedict, omelettes, pastas, salads, pancakes, burgers, panini, jacket potatoes, sandwiches and filled baguettes. Something for everyone. Situated in East London’s popular Petticoat Lane Market, on Wentworth Street and near the corner of Middlesex Street, the café is run by Turkish chef Ebru Puleri and her female Turkish friends. It’s a friendly, warm place, with comfortable seating, and popular with local workers, neighbours, market traders, students and visitors to London. It is walking distance from Aldgate East Tube and Liverpool Street Station. Open daily from early morning to 3pm.

review_data.review_title: Good ambiance, disappointing food, overrated overall
review_data.review: We visited Dar Moha this week after it was recommended to us by a pair of friends we met in the desert. The restaurant itself is cozy and the seating around the pool was very pretty. We were impressed with the service at first and enjoyed the musical entertainment. The price of the fixed menu shocked us though - 530Dh per person! This was more than double we had paid for any meal yet in Morocco!! We hadn't ate out much though, so we figured it must be worth it. It started off strong with at least 14 Moroccan salads & little appetizers brought to our table which were tasty and different. We ordered the pigeon pastry for our 2nd course, and expected a savoury pastry. It was coated in icing sugar & cinnamon which was unexpected. For our main, we had the lemon chicken and lamb tagines. Again, neither was extraordinary. My lamb was tough and tasteless. We'd had much better of both dishes for a fraction of the price at our riads. In total with wine, our bill was 695Dh each. We were allowed to pay by credit card, but the waiter miscalculated and undercharged our cards without us realizing. I was talking to the head waiter before we left, when the hostess came over and demanded the extra 100Dh. The head waiter took off and neither apologized for what was their mistake. We had also left a generous 150Dh tip for the server. Needless to say, we left with a very bad taste in our mouths. Save your money & don't go. Better food with equally good atmosphere can be had elsewhere I'm sure.

There wasn’t a bum note here, everything was superb but special mention goes to the scallop and smoked eel which was exceptional.  The wine flight was as good as I’ve had anywhere, great pairing and a lot of interesting choices of slightly less mainstream varieties and locations.  Service throughout was very good.  We will definitely return in the future.

review_data.review_title: One of the better restaurants in Siem Reap
review_data.review: Siem Reap gets many tourists, and many of them are in groups and wouldn't venture to an upmarket restaurant in a hotel. Food in Siem Reap can be very inexpensive, but with the low price comes a lack of quality produce and originality. Kroya is special. We first went because we were a little tired after arriving and it was easy. The 7 course Khmer tasting menu changes every night so no chance of getting bored with the food. There is an "normal" menu as well if you don't feel adventurous.  We had the tasting menu and enjoyed it very much. At $31 per head, it is great value. Wine is available at various price levels.We though the courses came out a little fast, but that is often the case in Asia, The size of the tasting plates was just right. I would comment that the wine was not quite chilled enough, but some time in the bucket solved that. Not a big problem.  Service was very friendly and fast enough, We ended up going more than once to avoid tourist food.

review_data.review_title: Unique cocktails in a wonderful bar.
review_data.review: Unfortunately we only just discovered this place on our last night in Hanoi but at least we discovered it then!!  Situated on the top floor of the stylish La Siesta Hang Be Hotel, there are many rooftop bars in the city but we found the cocktails here to be more adventurous than most.  The bar tenders/mixologists have really tried to come up with some unique flavours so as to capture the ‘feel’ of this exciting urban culture.  I tried the ‘Chef Inspired’ and ‘Guaranteed’: both enjoyable and unlike anything I’ve ever tasted before.  The views of Hanoi are spectacular and, on the floor below, is the ‘Cloud Nine’ restaurant which I have reviewed separately and loved. They also, of course, serve all the classics.  I would recommend trying this bar for some unique tastes.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Luxury Traveler

review_data.review: Experiencing the tasting menu at this restaurant is my highest recommendation and top tip following a month long visit to SE Asia.  We are fortunate to have eaten some excellent meals on five continents but this restaurant served us one of top five meals of all time.  The restaurant is staffed throughout by females and, without wishing to sound sexist, I truly believe you can taste and experience their delicate and feminine touch throughout.  My wife and I were privileged to enjoy their seven course, regularly changing, tasting menu and were rewarded with some exceptional, exquisite tastes. Presentation and service were exemplary too.  Combined with a four glass classic wine pairing for me and a four cup tea tasting for my wife, the cost isn't cheap in Siem Reap terms but at $36 per person for food, $29 for four glass of paired wine or $15 for four deliciously flavoured teas, it's incredible value for money given the quality of food, presentation and service on offer.  In addition we were given complementary amuse bouche to start, had opportunity to thank one of the chefs direct and were given a leaving gift of their exquisitely presented, complementary macaroons.  An exceptional experience that I would repeat in a heartbeat, I cannot recommend this restaurant more highly.  Do not miss.

My wife and I had been traveling SE Asia for a month and enjoyed everything from Street food to Michelin star quality.  We where unsure where to try a 'high end' meal in Hanoi, after being given several inconsistent recommendations by previous visitors or tour guides.  For us, Cloud Nine fitted the bill perfectly and we enjoyed our first visit so much that we chose to return again on our final night in Asia.  Located in the La Siesta Hàng be Hotel, just below the rooftop bar (both reviewed elsewhere) its central to the Old Quarter but has far reaching views in all directions across the city. The decor is undoubtedly chic, with a hint of French presented with a wonderful Asian style and finesse.  They served a mix of Vietnamese and western food, although we only ate from the Vietnamese menu.  They offer a tasting menu at £17 per head but each night we chose to dine a la carte and spent a little more (approx. £25 excluding drinks) but the food, quality, preparation and presentation was absolutely first class.  What sets this restaurant apart though is the quality of service. Anyone who has traveled in SE Asia will know that, if you pay a little more, the quality of service is consistently good. Here it was truly exceptional.  From the very first moment, restaurant supervisor/ maitre d', Amber, ensures that you're welcomed, relaxed and served to your satisfaction. Not that she should have any concerns, as the staff are all, without exception, attentive and polite.  On both occasions we ate here, our server was Huyen. An absolute delight to deal with, her English was seriously impressive, indeed we found her easier to understand than some of our more heavily accented tour guides! She really exceeded any reasonable expectations of service.  On our return visit we were both treated like long lost friends and we'll take memories such as that away with us.  For the record, over our two visits, we ate the special chef spring rolls, Hanoi deep fried spring rolls, Phu Bo, asparagus and crab meat soup, Tom Yum Kung soup, green mango seafood salad, beef on hot stones and Tiger prawns in coconut. We never made it to dessert! In addition, they serve a complimentary amuse bouche to start and a refreshing drink to close.  A truly wonderful experience and I would highly recommend.

This place is terrific! It's Greek cuisine but it's terrific for fish. We had the Greek spreads as appetizers along with the best grilled octopus we have ever had. I had Branzini and my wife had stuffed eggplant. Both dishes were terrific. But I have to give a real nod to service. Our waiter brought 3 bottles of wine for us to try. We selected our favorite and he opened the wine list to subtly confirm the price and selection with me. The concierge at the Essex House recommended this place and we give it rave reviews

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Luxury Traveler

review_data.review: So we brought back family and friends to this restaurant. We had enjoyed it on the recommendation of our concierge and wanted to bring back others. It was great! The star again was the grilled octopus but also great fish and vegetarian options. Greek dips and hummus were fantastic and wonderful service. Highlight was the chef visiting our table. Highly recommend

Nothing wrong here, but we found the food and extras very average compared to the very above average price.  Very nice outdoor dining area and good service though - if the prices were in line with the other restaurants in the area it'd be a 4 or 5 stars.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Luxury Traveler

review_data.review: Price is about average for the area (250-350 TKL per person), the food was good (though some cuts of meat on our mixed grill were overcooked). Very good service and a 'family' run atmosphere. Some bread, dips, and a baklava were complimentary.

This is a bit of a trek if you are staying in central Prague, but taxis are cheap and it is definitely worth the effort.  The serving staff were brilliant, and helped make the visit so enjoyable.  We had some excellent dishes, and the steak in particular was stunning.  Some really nice desserts followed by some strong-tasting liqueurs they insisted we have helped finish a stunning meal.  Give it a visit, but book a table as it gets busy.

All very good, service swift and bill was 1300 Krona.

Don't eat anything before a visit here. Book as if they have a party in it fills up quickly. Big burger, fries, we had 2 beers 2 dips and onion rings. Bill was 900 krona. Fast service tasty food. We had one burger with pear and blue cheese and a vegetarian one the same.
Had a great night at Benihana in a private room with Casper cooking and entertaining us. Thoroughly enjoyed it, great food although quite expensive

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Luxury Traveler

review_data.review: From the friendly Nepalese couple that proudly owns the place - how the World spins, right?! -, to the simplest of details - homemade bread with olive oil, Modena vinegar and a pinch of salt - this lovely spot in Alcântara (Rua do Olival) surely hosts the best Italian meal your money can buy in Lisbon.  This week is all about Truffles from Alba (Dinner exclusive!!!) so you can enjoy the Tortellinis and Scallopinis, subtly bathed in one of Italy's finest (and let us say tastiest) exports.  As mentioned, the owners are nice and will make you feel so comfortable you just can't stop talking (and drinking and ordering more food!).  One might find it pricey but I didn't think so - as also mentioned it is, in my humble opinion, the best Italian choice in the Portuguese capital.

The setting is not great but a wonderful meal none the less and would consider eating there again - I could probably overlook the speed of service for the quality of food you get. Pricing is reasonable and you get good portions.

I will go back again, but I will sit upstairs where hopefully the music doesn't conflict with digestion. I had the delightful round eggplant dish - yum!

review_data.review_title: Decent food but high prices and inexperienced service
review_data.review: I had my first dinner upon arriving in Hanoi at Mam Com Viet restaurant. I ordered the Hanoi Spring Rolls, Stir-Fried Chicken with Lemongrass, and a Banana Smoothie. The food was decent but the service was weak and very inexperienced. The food was also expensive, 99K VND for spring rolls is ridiculous for Hanoi standards, the total cost of the meal was 264K VND.  I had Mam Com Viet on my list of restaurants to dine at prior to arriving to Hanoi based off of the TripAdvisor reviews, however in the end I was disappointed. Some of the other dishes customers were enjoying looked good, however based on my experience I would not recommend this place to friends.

review_data.review_title: Like eating gourmet burgers in your best friend's house!
review_data.review: Based upon the numerous positive reviews, we had to give this a go. What really makes this place a standout is the service and hospitality. With a group of 9 ranging in ages from 74 to 7 months, anyone who can tackle all the personalities and questions with a smile and several jokes/chuckles deserves a medal. And then the food! Because of the comfortable atmosphere created by the staff/owners, it makes the burgers all the better. My two kids had the chicken skewers which were so tender and full of flavor. The burgers melted in your mouth. Quite honestly, the general consensus was that the burgers were slightly bland for our collective tastes (my father asked them to spice up his burger and that was "solved" by sprinkling some spice as opposed to putting it in the meat), but one cannot question the quality of cooking and ingredients. All in all, it was a really great meal and would recommend it to anyone who has a chance to dine here.

review_data.review_title: Come here for memorable service and food.
review_data.review: Rangoli doesn't mess around when authentic Indian food is concerned. From start to finish, everything on the menu is well prepared and presented.  I opted for the chicken Vindaloo - a hot dish for those into spice. I particularly liked the finishing touches of Mukhwas, which serves as authentic after dinner mints. /Mukh/ and /vas/ - denoted in the name, Mukhwas - literally translate as mouth and smell.  A meal consisting of a meat curry, rice, garlic naan (breads), five drinks and a Kulfi (Indian ice-cream) came to a very reasonable 840 CZK (just under 30GBP). This was plenty for the two of us and shall be returning with friends over the next couple of weeks.  As for the service I cannot fault it and was the prominent quality of our dining experience. The waiters greeted me with clemency and their attention to our overall comfort throughout our dining experience was sharp.

review_data.review_title: Not Just the Best Meal in Paris, but Perhaps the Best Meal Overall
review_data.review: In part we returned to Paris this year just to be able to have another meal at Le 114 Faubourg. It is our kind of place, elegant, but simple; refined but approachable; truly great food but without pretense. Beginning with an amuse bouche that was ideal for the Paris heat wave we were experiencing, the rest of the meal flowed as though it was individually designed for us. We will have yo return next year so that we can experience this amazing restaurant again. (Or perhaps we should just move to Paris!)

Huge fun  Very accommodating for children. The child menu is not condescending and exceptional value. Our grandchildren tasted and enjoyed new foods.  The setting may be a little tired... that happens when a place has been rightly popular for so long and it is difficult to fit in the time for a big refurb.

review_data.review_title: A very god, dependable Lebanese meal
review_data.review: Having been brought up in Beirut in the 1950s, I regard a good Lebanese meal as the ultimate comfort food, the flavours of my childhood. So I was delighted when a friend suggested that a group of us should go to Chamisse this week. It is a very good restaurant, most of the team are Lebanese and the welcome is warm.  The setting is very simple, which is fine: the focus is always on the food. We chose to have a selection of mezzo and a selection of grills placed down the table so that the group of 20 could chat and eat contentedly without making choices. This is where Lebanese food it as its best, being shared by everybody with a little bit of this and more of that up and down the table. Small dishes flowed in (kebbeh, kellaj, fatayr, hummus, mfassack, tabbouleh, fattoush, loubieh bel zeit, labneh, moutabbel and more besides) and all tasted very good. My only comment was that some of the flavours were slightly blander than I like but they were very good. In particular the kebbeh was as good as I have tasted (deliciously moist in the middle and crunchy on the outside) and the labneh was wonderfully subtle. So definitely 4 plus for the food.  Very good service too. The team were there to look after us very well throughout, making sure the dishes moved along, that glasses were full and that everyone was enjoying themselves. Not intrusive but we did benefit from their attention throughout.  What more can I say - I look forward to returning.
What a great surprise! French restaurant operated by French people. Great service and wonderful food!!!

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Luxury Traveler

review_data.review: Totally exceeded all our expectations. The restaurant was very quiet due to the Queens Jubilee celebrations but for us this was a bonus. All four courses were fantastic plus the added bonus of the included Prosecco,Negroni and Aperol Spritz. We loved the Negroni ! I think this was terrific value. The icing on the cake for me was Theo Randall was there cooking. I didn’t expect that on such a quiet Sunday afternoon. What a lovely man and a joy to meet. I am really looking forward to returning to try the regional tasting menus or another weekend brunch.

I will definitely return again next time we’re in Phuket! Thanks for a great evening all at The Kitchen Table!

review_data.review: Let me put it this way: a nice dinner that evening including cat entertainment. Palette is the star of this restaurant. Straying around the tables you get a visit from here once food is ready. What a funny moment. On our arrival she started her nap at the table next to me. In the moment the starters arrived she immediately woke up and started to „check“ what is going on there. We loved it. Let me get to the starters. The homemade foie gras I choose was delicious but slightly overpriced. 21 Euros for one single slice is too much. Even at Michelin rated restaurants the portion would be better. The main course was great, nothing to complain about. Good usage of spices and herbs, was a nice dish and good eventing. We can recommend this place.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Luxury Traveler

review_data.review_title: Great place, great food, a MUST GO in Paris!
review_data.review: Let me start with the dessert. Honestly, the Maitre can be relaxed now and lay back. I have to admit: one chocolate dessert on the menu and I will go for it. This one was exceptional. Great Praline mousse, nice chocolate sphere, nice crumble combination. It was death of chocolate, a very nice one. So let me begin with the starter. The champignons de bois had an excellent taste, an amazing texture. The salad topping was not mine, but all in a bite very good. The main course was an Argentine Entrecote, cooked to perfection. All these dishes are presented in a good manner at a nice location. The ambiance is great, following the theme of this restaurant. The host and the staff in general: keen, nice, helpful and attentive. Nothing to complain about and to be honest: we ate worse at Michelin Star restaurants. The location of the restaurant cannot be found without TripAdvisor. Hence, no mass tourism and no tourists who want to eat cheap and fast. We had a great evening and an absolutely fantastic dinner. This restaurant needs to be visited for sure!

Very first restaurant once we arrived in Marrakech and it was a good start. Despite of the fact that we had chosen French Cuisine we did not regret this. All dishes were cooked to perfection and the choice of fresh herbs and spices was excellent. We had lobster for starter to be continued with a great steak in a kind of Bernaise gravy. Was delicious. The hosts are very friendly and even the Maitre appeared at the table to ask for feedback. Well done. I finished that meal with a Cafe Gourmet which was a good choice. The only cons was that inside of restaurants in Morocco it is still allowed to smoke, a pitty especially in restaurants like this where you want to discover all tastes. Finally, we strongly recommend this place for sure and advice you to have a reservation in advance.

We treated ourselves to a 16 course meal with matching Argentine wine during our short stay in BA. What a wonderful experience; excellent and beautiful food, great service and lovely wine. The sommelier was excellent as was the waitresses. Highlight courses were the appetisers especially the scallop ball, the prawn and fish soup, beef and ice cream sandwich. Such great value so book early!

review_data.review_title: A highlight of our time in Buenos Aires
review_data.review: The evening we spent at Casa Salt Shaker was one of the best experiences we've had in Buenos Aires, and indeed one of the most interesting we've had throughout all of our travels anywhere. The "puerta cerrada" (or "closed door") movement is new to us, but we'll be searching it out more often. What sets Casa Salt Shaker apart (aside from the food and drink, but more on that later) is the communal table. While many closed door restaurants have gone to traditional restaurant style seating, Casa Salt Shaker has maintained their communal table which made for a delightful evening. We sat with 8 other English speaking guests from the US (living in Chile, and living in Alaska), UK and New Zealand. What a diverse and well traveled and engaging group!  Now - the food! Dan is a master in the kitchen! Three of us were pescatarians, so Dan made an entire pescatarian-friendly meal. The meat eaters among us were thrilled to take a break from their Argentine meat frenzy. We savored homemade bread, Peruvian ceviche, Timbuche (the most delicious cilantro/albacore soup I've ever had!), corn ravioli, pollack with chimichurri hollandaise, and pineapple cheesecake, along with perfectly paired wines. Along with being an extraordinary cook, Dan is also a wonderful conversationalist and we learned a lot about life as an expat in Argentina. Dan doesn't speak much English but is delightful with his shy smile and quiet demeanor. The $80 (US) that we spent each was an incredible value given the quality (and quantity) of the food and wine, No tiny tastes or mere splashes of wine here.

I usually go to my favorite restaurants here that I know that are very good but wanted to try something new. Unfortunately, none of us left impressed. Their menu mainly consists of local cuisine, which includes a lot of meat. I’m a pescatarian and I had a hard time finding more than one or two pescatarian dishes. The appetizer was good but nothing spectacular overall and we wouldn’t probably go back.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Luxury Traveler

review_data.review: Managed to squeeze in here last night and it was incredible. Our second time here (first was to see the jazz) and it was great! Have to say that ordering straight from the menu was much better quality than the set menu provided on the jazz night we attended.  My king prawn pathia was one of the best I’ve had before, my sister’s tikka masala was far from boring (tasted flame kissed, like proper tikka should) and the Bombay aloo was delicious too.  All of the curries are really chunky and flavourful - in other curry restaurants the sauces seem like they’ve just puréed all the ingredients then thrown in some onion chunks for texture. The food here is the opposite!  The manager is a really nice guy and is candid about how busy it gets/waiting times etc so you always know where you stand.  Sitara is just a lovely little family-run place with great food. We’ll be back!

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Luxury Traveler

review_data.review: This is the third time we’ve eaten at the Rajdoot and we’ll continue coming back again and again. The service is impeccable, there’s a good list of drinks and the food is always incredible. Everything is cooked fresh and you can really tell. We ordered for four and there wasn’t a thing left by the end - everyone was very full and very happy! Plus management offered us a complimentary digestif so it was Tia Maria and Baileys all round before we left. Best king prawn pathia I’ve had in London, and I’ve tried many. Already can’t wait to return!

The ability to produce fantastic food from a tiny kitchen never ceases to amaze me. Pou Restaurant and Bar accomplishes this quite well! We joined to friends for dinner one evening, but had to sit at separate tables because they had reservations and we did not. Yes it is that small. We made reservations for the six of us for the following evening, and were accommodated on one of their two larger tables.  Both dining experiences were fantastic. The Khmer chicken was excellent both times our table tried it. Also, the ginger tapioca dessert is something I’m going to try to duplicate at home. The creative menu and the use of local leaves, herbs, and flowers, sets this restaurant above many of the great places we tried during our travels to Singapore, Thailand, and Cambodia during this trip.  Yes, the staff may be a little disorganized at times, the kitchen is on the second floor, and the staircase is quite steep. But there’s a lot of love in this kitchen, and a lot of love in the presentation of the food, and I don’t think there’s anything better you can ever say about a restaurant.

review_data.review_title: Perfect steaks. Friendly and personal service

It turned out that he immigrated many years ago from Ukraine/Russia who initially studied something else but finally fulfilled his dream and opened a restaurant in Buenos Aires. The service and attitude couldn’t have been friendlier and more natural. We both decided to habe beef (of course) with grilled vegetables and papas fritas with garlic. The food was served fast and smoothly and it was just perfect. Altogether a great, high quality but also unpretentious dining experience for a very reasonable price.

review_data.review_title: The best quality and technically intelligent food we had
review_data.review: Highly recommended. This was not our favourite restaurant, but it was the best food for complexity and quality. The starter platters were excellent, really very good indeed. You choose either hot or cold and about 8 mini tasters arrive. All are delicious. We have mains of Lamb tagine and fish fillet and again they were very good.  The setting is lovely and unique. The pool, bamboo and creeping flowers giving it an African cheque feel similar to Senegal. It's more of a courtyard than riad and it benefits from it. If going in the evening book to make sure you are outside, but during the day we were able to just turn up.  The waiters english is not so good, this is very much a French resturant, but you'll not have any problems. The staff were freindly, welcoming and as the resutant emptied they let us sit on and read with mint tea as they reset for the evening around us.

review_data.review: This is a small restaurant in Montmartre at 37 rue Lamark that specializes in tartare (raw meat). The main part of the menu offers a variety of meats (salmon, beef, veal for example) that is prepared in any number of styles (about 15 different options): French, Italian, Mexican, Oriental, Greek, etc. You can order one, or a combo of three different ones. We ordered the salmon fixed in Italian style, and the beef fixed in a different style. The meat was incredibly tasty and tender. We also ordered a side salad, that was merely fresh lettuce with a light vinegar and oil dressing, and French fries cooked in duck fat. For dessert, our waiter offered us a dessert not on the menu, which turned out to be very thinly sliced fresh pineapple with a dulce leche (caramel) sauce drizzled on it and little toffee crumbles. It was very good and refreshing. We ordered a bottle of wine recommended by the waiter that we quite enjoyed. We recommend this restaurant if you are ok with Tartare. The total bill was about 75 euros, half of which was the wine.

review_data.review_title: Did not really hit the spot

The pickup service failure- they had to be reminded to pick us up after we had been waiting for 30 minutes- this is even after we had sent an email booking(not answered) plus a confirmation call from our hotel reception earlier in the day  Setting was nice and service was friendly - but hard to see who was learning and who was coaching - recently in Laos we went to one where they had T-shirts to show who did what  Unfortunately for the prices charged (high by Cambodian standards) they failed to deliver - especially the $10 prawns and red curry sauce - the 6 very small prawns were soft like crawfish (very disappointing), the red curry sauce was nice but we could of done with some more, red rice was also ok but to call this plate a main is a joke - 6 mouthfuls and it was all over!  We did like the complimentary spring rolls and the mango and sticky rice ($4) was a good rendition of an Asian classic.  We did have a bottle of Italian Pinot Grigio which was unexpectedly very dry and a nice bottle of French Chardonnay both of which were priced at around the $22 mark - not sure who was meant to be coaching the lovely young lady to get the cork out but together we got there in the end  Large Angkor beers around $4 each  Plus a small thing that’s annoying is not showing the fully inclusive prices........

review_data.review_title: Fantastic experience that should be on your list when you visit Queenstown!
review_data.review: My wife and I were lucky enough to first experience The Bunker on a trip to Queenstown back in 2002. We were quite surprised that after such a long time the restaurant was still making memories for locals and tourists alike.  This is not a restaurant that you decide to drop in on at the last minute. It's often booked out well in advance and sports around 7 or so tables for a very intimate dining experience with friends or loved ones. In fact, we booked over a month in advance to make sure they could seat our party of 5.  Plan to take your time and this is one location that it pays to trust the kitchen, as they have a fantastic degustation menu, featuring ingredients from the South Island of New Zealand. Matching New Zealand wines are also on offer and in my opinion you're missing a fabulous experience if you choose to à la carte.  We started the evening with cocktails followed by a dish titled "Amuse" - described as a daily creation or local delicacy. On this day, we were served a starter of Cervena Venison. It came cooked perfectly with 3 beautiful contrasting sauces.  The next dish was a choice from the Southern Ocean or Marlborough region, scallops or wild boar respectively. I chose the boar - Mille Peuille of apple, parsnip remoulade with a well matched Amisfield Pinot Gris from Central Otago.  The next course hailed from the West Coast or Bannockburn - Conit of baby abalone, or Seared Loin of hare and braised leg. The hare was served with confit kumura (New Zealand native sweet potato), sour cherries, kawakawa jus and a Surveyor Thompson Pinot Noir from Central Otago.  A nice little citrus sorbet followed as a palate cleanser.  The Main course was either a Centrol Otago Alpine Merino lamb backstrap and braised neck, or Nelson sourced seared pink snapper. The Merino Lamb was spectacular, served with baby vegetables, pea sponge, thyme jus and a Church Road Reserve Merlot/Cabernet blend from the Hawkes Bay.  Dessert was a classic New Zealand kiwi fruit pavola with local fruit and mascarpone with a Brancott Letter Series Late Harvest Sauvignon Blanc from Marlborough.  Lastly, we were treated to a local cheese selection with figs, nuts and a Cloudy Bay Late Harvest Riesling from Marlborough once again.  The wait staff were fantastic. Every course was described in detail and the quality of service was second to none.  Treat yourself to an experience and make sure The Bunker is on your list when you next visit Queenstown.  Highly Recommended.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Luxury Traveler

review_data.review_title: Cambodian food with a French flair
review_data.review: When we checked in, we were told there were two fine dining restaurants on property: one that served mostly western style food, and one that served Cambodian food.  We took door #2.  Dinner was served in a nicely decorated room, with classic jazz playing in the background – Miles Davis and Thelonious Monk.  The Khmer Savory Menu looked like a great deal – 55 USD with wine parings.  First a tempura oyster with three sauces. Small, but it was supposed to be just a taste.  Next came two kinds of fish cakes, with three garnishes: one a pickled papaya and onion; a raw green papaya salad; and purple cabbage. Everything was arranged on top of three spicy sauces and diced tomatoes.  This was followed by a chicken soup served over a mix of steamed and fresh vegetables.  We were served a mango intermezzo; and then the entrees. I selected the wok stir fried beef and vegetables, and my wife ordered the river bar fish. We traded off and agreed they were both excellent.  The meal was accompanied by fresh baked baguettes and two kinds of flavored butter.  We finished with a warm tapioca pudding, with diced bananas and a spoon of coconut ice cream.  At the end of the evening we decided it had far exceeded our expectations for food quality, presentation, and value. The overall amount of food was fine, and all the wine parings were appropriate.  Service was attentive, but not intrusive; and the pace was perfect.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Luxury Traveler

review_data.review: Not your typical restaurant. An oasis of fun and calm, very laid back. Comfortable seating, live music at night... a solo singer doing the old rock classics. The menu never seems to change, but a good mix of items. We loved the soups... both the taco and crab... order a cup... the bowl didn't seem like much more. Loved the avocado, the coconut shrimp, the chicken entree. Wine by the glass reasonable for NYC. Service was excellent.

We like the food here. Service can be erratic. On this visit the front of the restaurant was sectioned off for a private holiday party. Needless to say they were enjoying their cocktails and were very loud. This impacted our leisurely dining experience in a negative way. I believe when restaurants decide to take large parties that will impact the "regular" diner, they should accommodate the other patrons in some way... a drink, dessert, something to acknowledge the inconvenience... not just think it's ok.  Our coconut shrimp, crab cakes, salads, and the taco soup were very good. Chicken and Tuna entrees were enjoyed by all. The cold mashed potatoes served with the chicken were happily replaced.  Wines and drinks were very good.  Not our best meal here but still like the restaurant. Service needs improvement and ask about parties that may be booked... I guess it will calm down after the holidays but still beware.

review_data.review: I will start with the setting, which was lovely. Outside dining with blue and white tones, over looking the ocean (if you are there before sunset). Their online reservation system is VERY broken. We had a reservation for New Year’s Eve (we received an email confirmation) but when we showed up, they had no record of it. They informed us that they were not doing the menu that night and sent us on our way - where are you supposed to find another restaurant at 9 pm on New Year’s Eve? We decided to try again on January 2nd. Again made reservations online...and received an email confirmation. Got to the restaurant and they had no record of the reservation...at least this time they accommodated us. As I said before, a lovely setting. Our waiter had some struggles providing us with accurate menu information (actually was inaccurate on his description of several menu items) and overall the service was fair at best. If you are looking at their menu online - DON’T! It is not the same....and the menu at the restaurant was not descriptive - hard to know what you were going to get. We saw nothing served on a salt block. I am wondering if they have changed management or the menu compared to previous reviews - usually Trip Advisor is a good reflection of a restaurant- but not this time - look only at recent pictures and reviews! Most items were very overpriced! We had Tiger Prawn Cocktail - it was only 2 (two!) prawns and cost 750 Bhat! They were good, but really? We ordered two bottles of wine that were listed in the menu for 1700 bhat and we were charged 2000 bhat per bottle! As for main dishes- the ribeye was fair at best, the scallops were 4 scallops - very tender but otherwise very average...the best dish we had was the blue swimmer crab - 4 crabs, very tasty but a lot of work to eat. The Parmesan mashed potatoes were good, enough for two people. The Lobster Mac and Cheese? Not an accurate description at all...it was more of a pasta in a lobster bisque - no cheese to speak of. We ordered asparagus - sorry, they were out. So, I don’t usually tell people to avoid a restaurant - but we had much better meals and experiences in Phuket- eat elsewhere!

Let me preface this by saying we were visiting from the uk but we have a house in France where we live quite a bit of the year so we might be setting the bar quite high in terms of french food - and I’ve certainly been to worse french restaurants in france!  Indeed, we had a nice experience tonight but it wasn’t “great”. That said, they must be doing something right given it’s TA ranking (which is why we chose it, coupled to its proximity to our Central Park hotel) plus how busy it was  The positives for me were:  Ambience and service - lively and attentive respectively  My french onion soup entree was very good - but OTT on the Gruyère but very rich and deep tasting  The fries and mash potato accompaniments were excellent  Why I personally am only giving an average score though is…  My moules marinere were a bit anaemic  My sons filet mignon was medium rare but super charred on the outside - for 61 bucks (expensive by UK and french standards but the norm in NYC clearly), it could have been better)  My wife’s salad chèvre chaud was ok - in france the goats cheese would typically have been grilled on the bread and the dressing was overwhelmingly tart  The wine list was average and exorbitant - we ordered a 76 dollar Sauvignon blanc (one of the cheaper ones) it was ok but warm - I asked for a ice bucket but it was only the last glass that got close to an adequate temperature  Long story short, nice setting, attentive friendly service, ok food

review_data.review_title: The BEST Meal of Our Lives
review_data.review: OK, so this was special. We came to Paris for a week, to celebrate my beloved's 50th birthday. I did some research in advance, and decided that this will be the place.  First thanks go to Mariana, who communicated with me in advance of the visit. Professional, prompt to reply, working with us on the 6-course menu (we don't eat meat), adjusting it to our food preferences and the special touches for the celebration.  Then came the evening. Professional welcome, with elegance and grace. Once we got seated, we met James the sommelier. Unbelievably knowledgeable about wines and the profession at large. A delicious glass of champagne to start the evening, followed by an even more divine French red - to die for. On top of it, because we had fish, he recommended - and brought (on the house) - two glasses of white that fit the dish perfectly.  The service from the whole team was superb. SUPERB! Luc was equally professional and friendly, and we engaged in a few conversations about how they run the place, and the world of Michelin stars.  Then came dessert. Or, more specifically, first came the pre-dessert dish. It was followed by two separate dessert dishes, wrapping everything with a chocolate creation of one of the chefs who specializes in chocolate.  We have both "been around" and traveled various parts of the world, separate and together - and experienced a variety of restaurants. We unanimously agreed that this was THE BEST restaurant experience of our lives! Sure, it was also the most expensive one - and I would pay it again for this experience, without thinking twice.  Thank you Team Pur' for making this evening so unique for us!

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Luxury Traveler

review_data.review: My wife and I had been traveling SE Asia for a month and enjoyed everything from Street food to Michelin star quality.  We where unsure where to try a 'high end' meal in Hanoi, after being given several inconsistent recommendations by previous visitors or tour guides.  For us, Cloud Nine fitted the bill perfectly and we enjoyed our first visit so much that we chose to return again on our final night in Asia.  Located in the La Siesta Hàng be Hotel, just below the rooftop bar (both reviewed elsewhere) its central to the Old Quarter but has far reaching views in all directions across the city. The decor is undoubtedly chic, with a hint of French presented with a wonderful Asian style and finesse.  They served a mix of Vietnamese and western food, although we only ate from the Vietnamese menu.  They offer a tasting menu at £17 per head but each night we chose to dine a la carte and spent a little more (approx. £25 excluding drinks) but the food, quality, preparation and presentation was absolutely first class.  What sets this restaurant apart though is the quality of service. Anyone who has traveled in SE Asia will know that, if you pay a little more, the quality of service is consistently good. Here it was truly exceptional.  From the very first moment, restaurant supervisor/ maitre d', Amber, ensures that you're welcomed, relaxed and served to your satisfaction. Not that she should have any concerns, as the staff are all, without exception, attentive and polite.  On both occasions we ate here, our server was Huyen. An absolute delight to deal with, her English was seriously impressive, indeed we found her easier to understand than some of our more heavily accented tour guides! She really exceeded any reasonable expectations of service.  On our return visit we were both treated like long lost friends and we'll take memories such as that away with us.  For the record, over our two visits, we ate the special chef spring rolls, Hanoi deep fried spring rolls, Phu Bo, asparagus and crab meat soup, Tom Yum Kung soup, green mango seafood salad, beef on hot stones and Tiger prawns in coconut. We never made it to dessert! In addition, they serve a complimentary amuse bouche to start and a refreshing drink to close.  A truly wonderful experience and I would highly recommend.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Luxury Traveler

review_data.review: Experiencing the tasting menu at this restaurant is my highest recommendation and top tip following a month long visit to SE Asia.  We are fortunate to have eaten some excellent meals on five continents but this restaurant served us one of top five meals of all time.  The restaurant is staffed throughout by females and, without wishing to sound sexist, I truly believe you can taste and experience their delicate and feminine touch throughout.  My wife and I were privileged to enjoy their seven course, regularly changing, tasting menu and were rewarded with some exceptional, exquisite tastes. Presentation and service were exemplary too.  Combined with a four glass classic wine pairing for me and a four cup tea tasting for my wife, the cost isn't cheap in Siem Reap terms but at $36 per person for food, $29 for four glass of paired wine or $15 for four deliciously flavoured teas, it's incredible value for money given the quality of food, presentation and service on offer.  In addition we were given complementary amuse bouche to start, had opportunity to thank one of the chefs direct and were given a leaving gift of their exquisitely presented, complementary macaroons.  An exceptional experience that I would repeat in a heartbeat, I cannot recommend this restaurant more highly.  Do not miss.

review_data.review_title: Unique cocktails in a wonderful bar.
review_data.review: Unfortunately we only just discovered this place on our last night in Hanoi but at least we discovered it then!!  Situated on the top floor of the stylish La Siesta Hang Be Hotel, there are many rooftop bars in the city but we found the cocktails here to be more adventurous than most.  The bar tenders/mixologists have really tried to come up with some unique flavours so as to capture the ‘feel’ of this exciting urban culture.  I tried the ‘Chef Inspired’ and ‘Guaranteed’: both enjoyable and unlike anything I’ve ever tasted before.  The views of Hanoi are spectacular and, on the floor below, is the ‘Cloud Nine’ restaurant which I have reviewed separately and loved. They also, of course, serve all the classics.  I would recommend trying this bar for some unique tastes.

I come often to this pub and every time I am amazed with the staff and the good and the overall experience. 5 years I have been visiting and quality has not only been saved but even improved! This is not common with this type of restaurant.

review_data.review_title: Wind down here after a long day out in the sun
review_data.review: Came here after a long day exploring temples in the sun. Arrived into a spacious area. Outside there was a stall selling soaps made from natural ingredients. You can wash your hands there to try out the products before entering. Makes for a great souvenir :) Inside, we ordered fruity ice mountains and a glass of ice blended coffee for our tuktuk driver. It was such a treat! The owners were extremely friendly and we could spent the whole afternoon there. Highly recommended!

In a lovely setting in Trifecta, this restaurant is a great choice for those who want high-end dining but not the tiny-plates style that leave you hungry and wallet depleted. In fact, the opposite is the case here. The very reasonable $75 prix fixe allows a wide choice of first and second plates, with tradition and experimentation side-by-side. For a group of hearty eaters, don't have a big lunch in advance--we were quite full after the two courses and multiple amuse-bouches, before the very good dessert selections. No complaints here about the pace of service, it was attentive, warm and friendly and not rushed. Definitely would return.

review_data.review: This is another amazing social profit enterprise. They take in disadvantaged youth. They train, educate, coach and mentor young adults to be self-sustaining and employed in today’s world. They also run a 1st class restaurant with excellent food, ambience and incredible customer service. Thank You for what you do.

They take in disadvantaged youth - train them in life skills, work skills, hospitality management - being servers, cooks , chefs , managers etc. Then trainees are sent out to other hotels for internships and then after graduation they all find jobs in the local Siem Reap hospitality industry. A remarkable process. Train your staff well and they will look after your customers.

This restaurant is a dream and a Haven for dis-advantaged youth. Paul and his wife ( owners) started this project in order to provide youth with an opportunity to acquire life, work and employment skills. Youth go through an internship process for a number of months. When they graduate they are hired at local high-end restaurants as they have excellent hospitality skills, knowledge abilities. So, when in Siem Reap you will have to eat , so I ask that you dine at this restaurant support their cause.

I found this restaurant on TA / the reviews are very good and decided to try one of it’s Khmer stir fry dishes the menu is varied and has Khmer, Thai and some western food choices as well. The chicken stir fry was excellent - lots of fresh veggies and lots of really nice breast of chicken. The sauce was great, thanks - will be back again .
Simply amazing menu choices - super fresh, healthy, wholesome, delicious and great customer service. Whoo Hoo I highly recommend this restaurant

we always stop in and have dinner or lunch @ Tevy’s Place. Tevy and her staff are so welcoming. Excellent service and menu choices at a very reasonable price. She brings in and trains young women in all aspects of running a restaurant. Thanks for being a successful entrepreneur and for training, coaching and mentoring young adults.

I love this restaurant. The food was s 12/10 , interesting ambience, great staff and excellent customer service . If you sit a front you can watch them cook your meal. All female staff. review_data.review_title: So good we came back... Twice!
review_data.review: My partner visited six years ago and raved about Haven, a place with such good food, family staff feel, and Western management, that he took me with him on our visit to Siem Reap. We returned two days later to try more yummy menu items and were sad to leave! Khmer Amok Vegan and Pumpkin burger were our favorites. Local ice coffee and passion fruit spritzer were divine, and served with metal straws, a small detail we appreciated. Paul and Sara were amazing hosts, one on each visit, and were willing to answer all our questions about their Swiss foundation that does amazing practical charity work, in the Swiss-German apprenticeship style. The staff were all extremely helpful and well trained (better than most service we have elsewhere!). Prices are reasonable. Location is tucked away in quiet street a ten minute walk from the Made in Cambodia market. The garden and indoor seating areas were both charming. Thanks again, Paul and Sara, and hopefully see you sooner than six years (in the same location!).

Go try it.

review_data.review_title: Great Food, Great View, Great Service
review_data.review: This restaurant gets a highest rating on TripAdvisor for a reason. The menu is fantastic and wonderfully priced. You cannot beat the view. And the service is very good, especially from Huy, the captain. Make sure you try the Vietnamese pancakes: they are delicious!

Not much of a Biryani (Rice) person but my friend took me there insisting i need to try this place. The places ambiance was nice and much better then what i had come to expect from similar Indian joints in the same locality. Also it was packed , we got luck with a table and the service was still very good - the waiter helped with the selection and our dishes were served promptly.  I ordered a Murgh Hyderbadi Biryani for myself . My two friends being vegetarian's ordered a Subzi Masala Biryani. The Food were served in clay pot with a nan covering the top . Great presentation. The food tasted Yum but a bit too spicy - we did ask for mild spicy dishes. One of the first time i enjoyed a Biryani. The quantity's are huge and one dish is enough for at-lest two people.  From what i saw of other tables people were ordering all sorts of dishes and enjoying them. Will like to try out other stuff when i am next time over to.

review_data.review: We saw the long line on Saturday night and made a point to go back and try their tacos on Sunday. They did not disappoint. You order and pay and they you tell the cooks what you want on your tacos. I had one chicken and one pork with everything. They had a lot of meat, a good amount of spice without it being too much and very tasty. I liked the pork one better. I have to go back and try a steak one now. It is an order and standup and eat it place. So don’t plan on seating down for a meal. I would go back any time.
